nextEvent.name: Minnesota Timberwolves at Portland Trail Blazers

tickets.description: Minnesota Timberwolves at Portland Trail Blazers

injuries.longComment: Camara gets a long-term deal to stay with the Trail Blazers through 2029-30. The 25-year-old pro has become a key two-way piece for Portland and is coming off a season in which he averaged 11.3 points, 5.8 rebounds, 2.2 assists and 1.5 steals in 32.7 minutes per game across 78 appearances.
injuries.shortComment: Camara (knee) signed a four-year, $82 million contract extension with the Trail Blazers on Sunday, Shams Charania of ESPN reports.

items.headline: Camara (knee) signed a four-year, $82 million contract extension with the Trail Blazers on Sunday, Shams Charania of ESPN reports.
items.text: Camara gets a long-term deal to stay with the Trail Blazers through 2029-30. The 25-year-old pro has become a key two-way piece for Portland and is coming off a season in which he averaged 11.3 points, 5.8 rebounds, 2.2 assists and 1.5 steals in 32.7 minutes per game across 78 appearances.

injuries.longComment: Avdija didn't start the second half, and the team announced shortly after that he wouldn't return to the exhibition. Look for Kris Murray and Shaedon Sharpe to see an increase in minutes with Avdija shut down the rest of the way.
injuries.shortComment: Avdija has been ruled out for the rest of Thursday's preseason game against the Jazz due to upper back stiffness.

items.headline: Avdija has been ruled out for the rest of Thursday's preseason game against the Jazz due to upper back stiffness.
items.text: Avdija didn't start the second half, and the team announced shortly after that he wouldn't return to the exhibition. Look for Kris Murray and Shaedon Sharpe to see an increase in minutes with Avdija shut down the rest of the way.

injuries.longComment: Thybulle won't see any action during the preseason due to a lingering right knee injury. He'll have just under a week to get ready for the 2025-26 regular-season opener Wednesday against the Timberwolves.
injuries.shortComment: Thybulle (knee) has been ruled out for Thursday's preseason game against the Jazz.

items.headline: Thybulle (knee) has been ruled out for Thursday's preseason game against the Jazz.
items.text: Thybulle won't see any action during the preseason due to a lingering right knee injury. He'll have just under a week to get ready for the 2025-26 regular-season opener Wednesday against the Timberwolves.

injuries.longComment: Williams has participated in non-contact portions of training camp, and head coach Chauncey Billups in encouraged by the veteran big man's progress from his March arthroscopic knee surgery. Williams still remains unlikely to be available for Thursday's preseason opener in Golden State and perhaps more exhibition play beyond that. In the meantime, Yang Hansen and Duop Reath will battle for backup center minutes behind Donovan Clingan.
injuries.shortComment: Williams (knee) still hasn't been cleared for contact, Sean Highkin of Rip City Radio 620 Portland reports.

items.headline: Williams (knee) still hasn't been cleared for contact, Sean Highkin of Rip City Radio 620 Portland reports.
items.text: Williams has participated in non-contact portions of training camp, and head coach Chauncey Billups in encouraged by the veteran big man's progress from his March arthroscopic knee surgery. Williams still remains unlikely to be available for Thursday's preseason opener in Golden State and perhaps more exhibition play beyond that. In the meantime, Yang Hansen and Duop Reath will battle for backup center minutes behind Donovan Clingan.

injuries.longComment: Henderson sustained the injury during an offseason workout, and the timeline for a return will likely sideline him for the start of the upcoming season. With Henderson on the shelf, Portland will likely lean on Jrue Holiday and Shaedon Sharpe in the backcourt. A clearer path to minutes in the early going should exist for Rayan Rupert as well.
injuries.shortComment: The Trail Blazers announced Friday that Henderson will resume basketball activities in four-to-eight weeks after suffering a torn left hamstring, Marc J. Spears of ESPN.com reports.

items.headline: The Trail Blazers announced Friday that Henderson will resume basketball activities in four-to-eight weeks after suffering a torn left hamstring, Marc J. Spears of ESPN.com reports.
items.text: Henderson sustained the injury during an offseason workout, and the timeline for a return will likely sideline him for the start of the upcoming season. With Henderson on the shelf, Portland will likely lean on Jrue Holiday and Shaedon Sharpe in the backcourt. A clearer path to minutes in the early going should exist for Rayan Rupert as well.

injuries.longComment: Lillard underwent surgery on a torn Achilles tendon in his left foot over the summer after suffering the injury during the first round of the NBA playoffs with the Bucks against the Pacers. The veteran guard was then waived by Milwaukee on July 1, making him an unrestricted free agent. The future Hall of Famer then decided to return to the Blazers on a three-year contract worth $42 million with a player option for the 2027-28 season. He also has a no-trade clause in his deal.
injuries.shortComment: Lillard won't be back on the court for the 2025-26 season, as he made clear during an interview with YouTube influencer Speed on Wednesday.

items.headline: Lillard won't be back on the court for the 2025-26 season, as he made clear during an interview with YouTube influencer Speed on Wednesday.
items.text: Lillard underwent surgery on a torn Achilles tendon in his left foot over the summer after suffering the injury during the first round of the NBA playoffs with the Bucks against the Pacers. The veteran guard was then waived by Milwaukee on July 1, making him an unrestricted free agent. The future Hall of Famer then decided to return to the Blazers on a three-year contract worth $42 million with a player option for the 2027-28 season. He also has a no-trade clause in his deal.
